body:
Custom roles are roles that customers can set up by themselves on the HackerRank for Work (HRW) platform.

Follow the below steps to learn custom roles on our platform.

  • Log in to the application and access the Roles Management module from the top left corner of the screen.
  • Click on Create Role.
  • In the popup that opens, give a Role name.

Note: Each role name should be unique. If you wish to create another role with the same name, you need to archive or rename the existing one first.

  • In the Role Detail screen, add skills from the right panel that matches with the role that you are creating. You can add multiple skills in this step.
  • Click on the  icon beside each skill to know the skill definition and number of questions present in the library on that skill. Skills are defined by keeping the current market standards in mind.

 

Once the required skills are added, you can publish the role by clicking on the publish button.

  • The only way to modify an already published role is by renaming the same and creating a new one or by archiving the role. HRW allows renaming of an already published role so that customers can free up roles names while creating new ones.

 

Note: You cannot use a custom role until it is published. And once published you cannot modify the role (add or remove skills, delete role, etc) further.

 

  • Once the Role is published, you can view the same in the Active Roles section of the Roles Management module. 
  • You can also search a role by the role name to find it easily among all the active roles.

 

Watch the clip below to get a clear idea of how roles are created on the HackerRank for Work platform.
title: How to create custom roles on HackerRank for Work
